title: 4.x - Partial following paths
body:
In a template file I had this:

    $this->extend('MeCms./Common/widget');

But the `Common` directory had already been renamed to `common` to prepare for the upgrade to CakePHP 4.

This is the warning that is shown and that is also saved in the logs:

```
2020-01-29 14:49:29 Warning: Warning (512): Could not render cell - Cell template file 'widget.php' could not be found.

The following paths were searched:

- /home/mirko/Server/quadrifoglio/templates/plugin/MeCms/
- /home/mirko/Libs/Plugins/me-cms/templates/
- /home/mirko/Server/quadrifoglio/templates/
- /home/mirko/Server/quadrifoglio/vendor/cakephp/cakephp/templates/
 [widget.php, line 204] in [/home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/View/Cell.php, line 271]
Request URL: /
Trace:
Cake\Error\BaseErrorHandler::handleError() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Error/BaseErrorHandler.php, line 188
DebugKit\Plugin::DebugKit\{closure}() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/Plugin.php, line 105
Cake\View\Cell::__toString() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/View/Cell.php, line 271
implode - [internal], line ??
MeCms\View\Helper\WidgetHelper::all() - /home/mirko/Libs/Plugins/me-cms/src/View/Helper/WidgetHelper.php, line 64
include - ROOT/templates/plugin/MeCms/layout/default.php, line 65
Cake\View\View::_evaluate() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/View/View.php, line 1163
Cake\View\View::_render() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/View/View.php, line 1124
Cake\View\View::renderLayout() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/View/View.php, line 802
MeCms\View\View::renderLayout() - /home/mirko/Libs/Plugins/me-cms/src/View/View.php, line 111
MeCms\View\View\AppView::renderLayout() - /home/mirko/Libs/Plugins/me-cms/src/View/View/AppView.php, line 110
Cake\View\View::render() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/View/View.php, line 761
Cake\Controller\Controller::render() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Controller/Controller.php, line 691
Cake\Controller\Controller::invokeAction() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Controller/Controller.php, line 533
Cake\Controller\ControllerFactory::invoke() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Controller/ControllerFactory.php, line 79
Cake\Http\BaseApplication::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/BaseApplication.php, line 229
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 77
Cake\Http\Middleware\EncryptedCookieMiddleware::process() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Middleware/EncryptedCookieMiddleware.php, line 93
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 73
Cake\Routing\Middleware\RoutingMiddleware::process() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Routing/Middleware/RoutingMiddleware.php, line 156
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 73
Cake\Routing\Middleware\AssetMiddleware::process() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Routing/Middleware/AssetMiddleware.php, line 68
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 73
Cake\Error\Middleware\ErrorHandlerMiddleware::process() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Error/Middleware/ErrorHandlerMiddleware.php, line 118
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 73
DebugKit\Middleware\DebugKitMiddleware::process() - ROOT/vendor/cakephp/debug_kit/src/Middleware/DebugKitMiddleware.php, line 60
Cake\Http\Runner::handle() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 73
Cake\Http\Runner::run() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Runner.php, line 58
Cake\Http\Server::run() - /home/mirko/Libs/cakephp/src/Http/Server.php, line 90
[main] - ROOT/webroot/index.php, line 40
```

Since:
1) it is not understandable which is the template file where the warning occurs;
2) the paths in which the template file is searched for are inexplicably only partially shown (the sub-directory `Common` is not mentioned)
It took me a few hours to pinpoint the problem, because the app in question and its plugins are "vast" and because I didn't remember who or what could extend that template file.

Is it not possible or to be considered appropriate to make that warning clearer and more useful?
Thanks.
